question: Which country's national cricket team is nicknamed as the "Proteas"?
explanation: South Africa's national cricket team is nicknamed as the "Proteas". The South Africa national cricket team also known as Proteas represents South Africa in men's international cricket, is administered by Cricket South Africa. South Africa is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One-Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 International (T20I) status. South Africa entered first-class and international cricket at the same time when they hosted an England cricket team in the 1888â€“89 season.
